description:
The crash occurred in the middle of a four-way intersection. Conditions were daylight with
                        rain in the morning on a weekday. Both lanes had a posted speed limit of 72 kmph (45 mph).


                        V1 was a 2003 Kia Rio sedan traveling southbound in the right lane approaching the intersection
                        with a blinking beacon light. V2, a 2002 Honda Civic sedan, was traveling northbound in the
                        right lane approaching the same intersection. V1 made a left turn in front of V2 and the front
                        of V2 struck the right side of V1 in the middle of the intersection. The two vehicles then
                        side-slapped the front right bumper of V1 hit the right rear wheel rim of V2. V1 came to final
                        rest facing west. V2 came to final rest facing northeast.


                        V1 was driven by a 44-year-old female who was not injured. She stated that she thought that V2
                        was turning so she made a left turn in front of V2. The front of V2 struck the right side of V1.
                        V1 was traveling between 50 and 64 kmph (31 and 40 mph) at the time of impact. V1 was towed due
                        to damage.


                        The Critical Precrash Event for V1 was this vehicle traveling and turning left at the
                        intersection. The Critical Reason for the Critical Precrash Event was a false assumption of
                        other road user's actions.


                        V2 was driven by a 19-year-old male who was not injured. He stated that he was going straight
                        when he saw V1 make a left turn in front of him. He swerved left and braked but was
                        unsuccessful. V2 was traveling between (21 and 30 mph) at the time of impact. V2 was towed due
                        to damage.


                        The Critical Precrash Event for V2 was the other vehicle encroachment from the opposite
                        direction over the left lane line. The Critical Reason for the Critical Precrash Event was not
                        coded to this vehicle. No associated factors were coded to this driver. The driver of V2 drives
                        this road regularly and is familiar with the roadway. The driver works 40 per week and feels
                        rested.
